lexUnit.name: helmet.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a hard or padded protective hat.

sentence.text: Temperatures were so high in some of the deep mines that the ` tinners " had to be sprayed with cold water while they worked in the dark with candles fixed to their helmets .
In the train he sat opposite me with his rifle across his knees and his steel helmet drowning his face .
He was a mousy man : long thin strands of hair protruded erratically from under his steel helmet .
His black hair curled under the edge of his helmet and fell to his eyes , and there was a gap between his teeth .
Liessa reached up and removed her helmet , letting the coils of red hair tumble out .
The two men looked small and vulnerable in their leather helmets , harnesses and bulky coats .
Able to see by lights from their pit helmets , the trapped miners cut the pipe at their end of the blockage while their rescuers did the same , pumping through fresh air by fan .
The shrapnel shot through Tom 's steel helmet and lodged in his temple during the epic fighting at Dunkirk .
Chuck and Joseph were hunched on facing seats in the covered interior , their sun helmets touching the underside of the curved wooden roof .
If force was ruled out as you say , why were 150 riot police equipped with riot helmets , shields and batons needed to remove 51 people , of whom 43 were women and children ? "
In other well-fed , well-clad workers were tapping trees while friendly , attentive Frenchmen in sun helmets looked indulgently over their shoulders .
Air-raid wardens in tin helmets watched the skies and silence descended on the empty streets .
The mousy man had gone to sleep and a jolt from the train knocked his steel helmet off the rack onto his knees .
It took only fifteen minutes before she was removing her bulbous black space helmet outside the house on avenue Foch .
The crested helmet of the warrior gleamed in dawn sun and he turned and rode down on Tallis .
The plane bumped to a halt , the engine coughed and died , and two figures in leather flying helmets swung out of the open cockpit and came towards them arm in arm .
The princess removes her white crash helmet to chat to a fellow team member .
Middlesbrough men John Rigg and Jim Stokes donned crash helmets and fire-proof overalls to take part in the Sealink Stena Challenge .
Protective gloves and a safety helmet are worn to minimize injury .
There was a sentry in a steel helmet at the door .
We were wearing wetsuits , helmets and lamps and carrying ex-army ammunition boxes that were watertight and into which had gone the cameras and flashguns we were going to use to photograph the mine .
He sat down now in the hide and put the helmet on .
He put on the helmet and climbed on the pillion .
With his other hand he took the helmet off .
Mitch took off his helmet .
When he took off his dented helmet he proved to have bristly fair hair above a snub-nosed face .
He was not wearing a crash helmet .
The leader wore a golden helmet .
The boy tipped back his yellow helmet and scratched his head .
I played Knights with my brothers and sisters , wearing a suit of plastic armour and a helmet with a visor .
In the struggle with Richard Bennett the officers ' helmets were knocked off and stolen by people in a crowd that gathered to watch .
